_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Highwater Ethanol, LLC. is committed to the protection of its employees, the greater community and the environment from any hazardous substances used in its chemical manufacturing process, specifically anhydrous ammonia. It is the policy of Highwater Ethanol, LLC. to comply with all Federal, State and Local laws.  The Highwater Ethanol, LLC.  facility has a detailed Emergency Response Plan that is utilized to respond to any accidental releases.

Facility Description and Regulated Substance Handled

Highwater Ethanol, LLC. operates a ethanol manufacturing facility located in Lamberton, Redwood County, Minnesota. Anhydrous ammonia is a key component or a refrigeration system.  The liquid ammonia is fed into the sealed process and is completely enclosed during the process. The maximum amount of anhydrous ammonia stored on-site is 109,456 pounds.

General Accident Release Prevention Program

Through completion of this RMP, Highwater Ethanol, LLC. has complied with the EPA requirements under 40 CFR Part 68. Process safety information and operations/maintenance procedures are documented on site. Periodic functions such as process hazard analysis, training, change management and incident investigation are/will be conducted on a regular basis. Audits of the overall RMP will be conducted on a regular basis to assure compliance with EPA regulations.

Five-Year Accident History

No ammonia accidents causing death, environmental or property damage, evacuations, or in-place sheltering have occurred in the last five years at the manufacturing facility.

The Emergency Response Program

In the event of an emergency, it is the policy of the Highwater Ethanol, LLC. to notify the local (Lamberton Fire Department) Fire Department and evacuate all employees from the facility when deemed necessary by the spill coordinator.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:  

Highwater Ethanol, LLC.  has an ongoing and continuing process to
update and review our manufacturing process for safety considerations.
